Sorry for Your Loss

A bereavement service for the digitally dispossessed

The Grief · The Box · The Memorial · The Farewell
· · · · · · · · · · · ·

You know that feeling. You're trying to log into something — could be anything, your old email, your first social media account, that cloud storage you set up in college — and the screen says "Account not found."

Or worse, it asks for a phone number you haven't had since 2013. And behind that wall? Ten years of photos. Messages from someone who's gone now. Your grandmother's pierogi recipe.

People tell you to move on. "It's just data." But you know it's not.

We know it's not.

That's why we started Sorry for Your Loss. Not because the world needed another subscription box. But because nobody was sending condolence cards when your Hotmail died. Nobody was holding space for the quiet devastation of a deactivated account. We are.

FAQ

> We conduct a secular digital farewell protocol. Your usernames
> and passwords are etched onto biodegradable rice paper, shredded
> in a commercial-grade document destroyer, and the remains are
> mailed back to you with a certificate of completion.
> Optionally, a streamed video of the event is available for $4.99.
